'''Necrophilia''', also called '''thanatophilia''' and '''necrolagnia''', is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a [[human sexuality|sexual]] attraction to corpses. The word is artificially derived from Ancient Greek: ''Î½ÎµÎºÏÏÏ '' (''nekros''; "corpse," or "dead") and ÏÎ¹Î»Î¯Î± (''philia''; "love"). The term appears<ref name="litera">{{ru icon}} [http://www.netslova.ru/gorny/necro.html "ÐÐÐÐ ÐÐ¤ÐÐÐÐ¯ ÐÐÐ Ð¡Ð¢Ð Ð£ÐÐ¢Ð£Ð Ð Ð¡ÐÐÐÐÐÐÐ¯"], 2002.</ref> to have originated from [[Richard Freiherr von Krafft-Ebing|Krafft-Ebing]]'s 1886 work ''[[Psychopathia Sexualis (book)|Psychopathia Sexualis]]''.<ref>Krafft-Ebing, Richard von (1886). ''Psychopathia Sexualis''. English translation: ISBN 1-55970-425-X.</ref> David R. Segur convicted of having sex with his dead baby daughter in Monroe, Michigan. The youngest son has no comment but is concerned that his father may kill him before it's all over.
